title: Namibia: Rössing Workers Protest Against Cameras in Haul Trucks
text:
Africa: Unethical Leadership Linked to Political Instability in the Country 
The concerned truck was also 'parked' until the matter is resolved between the company and the workers' representatives. 
More than 100 workers marched to the management's office, demanding that the suspension be lifted and for an explanation regarding the cameras. 
Apparently, two cameras were installed on one truck - one outside and another in the cabin facing the driver. There is also apparently a recorder in the cabin. 
The other haul trucks are also expected to have the same equipment installed over the next few weeks. 
A union representative said the workers are uncomfortable with the new equipment since they were never informed that the company would monitor them during work. 
"The workers want clarity. They do not want to be victimised. Some say they want to check if the workers are sleeping on duty or using cellphones. Others say it is to check for blind spots and therefore it is for safety purposes. All we are asking is for clarity," the unionist said. 
The Namibian understands that the suspended worker was reinstated yesterday afternoon, thereby ending the strike. 
Upon inquiry, Rössing's managing director Werner Duvenhage said that the employees working in the mining department handed over a petition to the Rössing management yesterday. 
He confirmed that they petitioned the use of a camera installed in a haul truck "as part of a pilot project implemented earlier this month in the mining department". 
"The camera was installed as part of a trial project to improve the mining area's safety standards. Consultations took place prior to the inception of the project with the relevant employee representatives and employees themselves," he said. 
As a result of the petition handover, operations in the open pit area were temporarily suspended. The impact on overall production at Rössing was minimal and normal operations have been fully restored, he added. Namibia
